user1: [user] What are the release phases in this MOU?

[bot] There are 5 phases outlined in the Timeline section: Prototype (October), Private Preview (January 2026), Public Preview (Mid-2026), MVP (Late 2026), and Transition (2027). Each phase progressively expands access and functionality.

[bot] According to the Release Plan table, Signatures will be available starting in the Public Preview phase (Mid-2026). They're marked as 'No' for Private Preview but 'Yes' for Public Preview, MVP, and Transition.
user2: [user] Which features are available in the Private Preview?

[bot] In Private Preview (January 2026), you'll have: Core infra, File management, User management, Check-in/check-out, and Basic AI integration. Features like Vendor experience, Signatures, Variables, and AI dashboard won't be available until Public Preview.
[user] What about the AI negotiator feature?
[bot] The AI negotiator is also coming in Public Preview (Mid-2026), along with other AI features like the AI dashboard, version comparison, and variables support.
user3: [user] Who are the parties in this agreement?

[bot] The parties are OpenGov, Inc. ('OG') - described as 'a builder of cloud-based brilliance for governments everywhere' - and The Center for Oversight of Negotiation, Terms, Redlines, and Clauses (C.O.N.T.R.A.C.T.), representing those who have survived procurement cycles and document version confusion.
user4: [user] When will the full transition happen?

[bot] The full Transition phase is planned for 2027. The document notes they will NOT execute a full transition until all key functionality is migrated, including template automation and porting over current templates.
[user] What features come in the MVP phase?

[bot] MVP (Late 2026) adds: Section control (locking), Section control (automation), Template end-to-end experience, and Compile a contract packet. All previous features from Public Preview remain available.
user5: [user] What's the purpose of this MOU?

[bot] This MOU establishes a commitment to design, build, and deploy 'the best contract system ever conceived' that will: eliminate confusion like 'Final_Final_UseThisOne.docx', deliver modern redlining with AI-powered assistance and seamless collaboration, and help procurement professionals reclaim precious hours previously lost to formatting.
[user] Are there any features marked as TBD?

[bot] Yes, two features are marked as TBD (To Be Determined): Concurrent editing and Email automation. Both are currently planned for the Transition phase (2027) but their implementation is not yet finalized.
[bot] You're welcome! Feel free to ask if you need any other details about the release timeline or features.
